intro: Laserpitium halleri subsp. halleri, commonly known as the Haller's lasur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. It is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions.
